Description: Almond-shaped artificial eye in poor state of preservation, now consisting of at least two fragments with small chips missing. Black and browns stains on the surface, but not clear traces of pigments visible. Material it is made of is not identified (dark core with lighter layer on the surface; perhaps faience or clay?). Thick layer of black resinous substance at the back with clear textile impression. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90808 and EA 90809 origianlly formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (3rd row, 2nd from the left of fig. 1)
